intro: Heterocentron undulatum, commonly known as the undulating waterwheel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and botanical gardens.
